item.title: Abandonware: evaluating the health of the libraries in your project
item.description: Open Source Dependencies ðŸ”—I find it very interesting how comfortable we, software engineers, have become with the notion of including thousands, and thousands, of lines of code we know nothing about in our projects. I don’t think reusing open-source libraries is bad. Quite the opposite; I am convinced that software development based on open-source software (OSS) is what allows us to move ahead in the industry at a fast pace.
